text.__SUMMARY__: Armillaria sinapina is a species of mushroom in the family Physalacriaceae. A plant pathogenic fungus, it causes  Armillaria root disease, and has been found on a variety of tree hosts in Alaska. The mycelium of the fungus is bioluminescent.
text.See also:
List of Armillaria species
List of bioluminescent fungi
